abridge verb [T]
(make shorter)
Add to word list

to make a book, play, or piece of writing shorter by removing details and information that is not important: The book was abridged for children.

abridge verb [T]
(reduce rights)
to reduce someone's freedom, rights, etc.: He said that Congress would make no law abridging the freedom of speech. Had the state abridged his rights?
More examplesFewer examplesThe mode of punishment must not abridge the liberty of the defendant.The legislation abridged the religious freedom of consumers who observe Saturday rather than Sunday as a day of rest. The people feared that if the state became too powerful, government would abridge the liberties of the people.
